name: Diki-Diki
instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients over ice and shake
2. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, serve up
description: A revived golden-era cocktail and fabulous way to tinker with Swedish Punsch

ingredients.name: Apple Brandy
ingredients.description: Apple brandy is a distilled spirit made from fermented apple juice or cider. The production involves fermenting apples, distilling the resulting liquid, and often aging it in oak barrels. The final product can range from clear to amber in color and exhibits a variety of apple-derived flavors, influenced by the apple varieties used and the aging process. Apple brandy can be enjoyed on its own or used in cocktails and culinary applications. The term encompasses a broad category of apple-based spirits produced globally, with variations in production methods and flavor profiles.

ingredients.name: Swedish punsch
ingredients.description: Swedish Punsch (not to be confused with punch) is also known as Arrack Punsch, Caloric Punch, Punssi in Finnish, and simply as Punsch. Based on Batavia arrack, it is a style of liqueur popular in Sweden and other Nordic countries (Norwegian Punsch was also produced by the state-owned monopoly), with a strength ranging from 27% - 50% alc./vol.

ingredients.name: Grapefruit juice
ingredients.description:
Grapefruit juice is a bold and distinctive cocktail ingredient, known for its tart, bitter-sweet flavor profile. Extracted from the grapefruit, a citrus fruit larger and more acidic than oranges, this juice brings a complex taste that can range from bracingly sour to subtly sweet, depending on the variety of grapefruit used.


In cocktails, grapefruit juice adds a sophisticated and refreshing element. Its natural bitterness and acidity make it an excellent counterpoint to sweet liqueurs and spirits, creating well-balanced drinks. The juice also contributes a lovely pink or ruby hue to cocktails, enhancing their visual appeal.
Popular in classics like the Paloma and the Greyhound, grapefruit juice pairs particularly well with tequila, vodka, and gin. When using grapefruit juice in cocktails, freshly squeezed is ideal for the brightest flavor, though high-quality bottled juices can be a convenient alternative. The amount used can vary, but its strong flavor means a little often goes a long way in cocktail recipes.
